heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike was on 13 May 2025, at a distance of 4.97 miles.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 11 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and cloud levels (up 474 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 115.3m higher than yesterday, 97.9m lower than the past week, 474.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 866m and a high of 3020m, averaging 1832.5m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and periods of sunshine are expected. Weather could become unsettled.
